TEI.2.document_title: Edward Gritten to James F. Perry, 08-04-1835

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., The Austin Papers, (Austin: University of Texas Press, 1927), 3 vols., Vol 3, pp. 97

div1.p: Immediately on my arrival here I made enquiries after our mutual friend Col. Austin and learned from Col. Ugartechea that he is still in Mexico, doing well and at liberty. An Officer is here who lately left that capital and brings the intelligence, I shall therefore endeavour to find him out and will transmit to you further particulars Being much occupied I have no time for more than to Subscribe myself
[Addressed:] James F. Perry Esq. San Felipe de Austin
